title: DAILY DIVIDEND | Tue, 13 Jan
html:
Google hits $4T, new 25% Iran tariffs, and Abercrombie & Fitch down -18%‚Ä¶ here's why?

S&P 500: +0.16% | Gold: +2.5% | Bitcoin: +0.64% | VIX: +4.35%

üáÆüá∑ Iran "Business" Tariffs

President Trump announced a massive 25% tariff on any nation "doing business" with Iran, effective immediately. White House is weighing military options against Iran for as early as today.

üîç STOCK SPOTLIGHT

Alphabet (Search & AI) +1% & Apple (Tech) +0.33%
Google hit a historic $4 trillion valuation after confirming its Gemini AI will be used in Apple‚Äôs new Siri and "Apple Intelligence" features.

Paramount (Entertainment) +0.75% & Warner Bros (Media) -1.68%
Paramount sued WBD to force disclosure on a rival $82.7 billion Netflix deal, escalating a proxy fight to prove its own all-cash bid is superior.

Abercrombie & Fitch (Apparel) -17.67%
A retail rout ensued after A&F lowered its Q4 guidance: Urban Outfitters, American Eagle, Victoria Secret, Gap & Macy‚Äôs all fell as investors worried about consumer demand.

üìò Term of the Day: Guidance
A public company's official estimate of its own future earnings and revenue performance. If a company "misses" its guidance or lowers it (as seen with A&F today), the stock often crashes because investors lose confidence in future growth.

Disclaimer: Educational purposes only. Not investment advice.
